Class ec.identity.IdentityException 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----java.lang.Throwable
           |
           +----java.lang.Exception
                   |
                   +----ec.identity.IdentityException
public class IdentityException
extends Exception
Generic exception class for identity errors. A generic exception class with error codes is used to avoid the overhead of many simple classes which all do almost the same thing. Subclasses can be added (this flexibility may be useful if Identity is subclassed) and should be marked with the NON_STANDARD_EXCEPTION code.

See Also:
Identity

CAPABILITY_BLOCKED
Requested capability is blocked by the target identity
CAPABILITY_NOT_IMPLEMENTED
Target identity does not implement the requested capability
CAPABILITY_REFUSED
Target identity refuses calling identity the requested capability
COULD_NOT_REACH
Could not contact target identity
INVALID_CAPABILITY
Invalid capability given to check capability request
NON_STANDARD_EXCEPTION
Code used by all subclasses of IdentityException, which are not part of the well known set of identity errors
PROTOCOL_ERROR
Protocol error while communicating with identity

IdentityException 
 public IdentityException(String message)
String argument constructor needed by comm system (so that this exception can be reconstructed after being ethrown across the wire). Unfortunately this has to be public. XXX This is a horrible but without this constructor the comm system blows up with a NoSuchMethodError and the connection dies!!!

errorCodeToString 
 public static String errorCodeToString(int errorCode)
Convert given error code to an appropriate string error message. This message is NOT designed for users, it is intended for use in debugging logs, trace messages etc. User error messages should be done at a higher level where there is more context about the purpose of the identity request.

 public int getErrorCode()
Get error code
